content.description: Sustained, fun face climbing on high quality vertical rock leads to a classic canyon undercling traverse.
content.protection: Tiny to hands. Emphasis on the thinner side of "standard rack." Small offset stoppers are useful.
content.location: Starts across the gully and uphill in the north side of Pineapple Buttress between two very large shade trees on a man made belay ledge of talus supported by some logs. Look for the right trending thin seam with a bolt about 1/3 of the way up.

content.description: An easy start gains the hand crack. Using both the crack and surrounding jugs, continue up to where the crack narrows. Once the crack ends, continue up on licheny slab to the summit. Belay on the backside.
content.protection: Single rack to #3. A few medium pieces for the belay. Walk off to the south.
content.location: This climb starts pretty much right off the trail, on the low right flank of the Watchtower, in a clump of trees. It is below and north of Pineapple Buttress.
